Class Temperature

java.lang.Object
Temperature
public class Temperature extends Object
This is a class for storing and comparing temperatures specified in various scales.
Author:
Kevin Lillis

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    private static enum 
    Temperature.Scale
    Private enumeration for the four temperature scales.

  • Field Details

    • degK

      private double degK
      This is the only instance variable. It stores the temperature in degrees Kelvin.

    • ABSOLUTE_ZERO

      public static final double ABSOLUTE_ZERO
      The lowest possible temperature, absolute zero.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • KELVIN

      public static final Temperature.Scale KELVIN
      Public Scale value indicating Kelvin.

    • RANKINE

      public static final Temperature.Scale RANKINE
      Public Scale value indicating Rankine.

    • CELSIUS

      public static final Temperature.Scale CELSIUS
      Public Scale value indicating Celsius.

    • FAHRENHEIT

      public static final Temperature.Scale FAHRENHEIT
      Public Scale value indicating Fahrenheit.

  • Constructor Details

    • Temperature

      public Temperature()
      Default constructor. Sets temperature to absolute zero, which is 0 Kelvin. This constructor should call the Temperature(double, Scale) constructor.

    • Temperature

      public Temperature(double degK)
      Constructor that takes only the temperature as an argument. The temperature given is in degrees Kelvin. This constructor should call the Temperature(double, Scale) constructor.
      Parameters:
      degK - Temperature in degrees Kelvin

    • Temperature

      public Temperature(double deg, Temperature.Scale scale)
      Constructor that takes a temperature and a scale as arguments. This constructor should call the set(double, Scale) method to actually set the temperature.
      Parameters:
      deg - degrees given in the specified scale
      scale - scale used for the given temperature

  • Method Details

    • FtoK

      private double FtoK(double degF)
      Private method to convert degrees Fahrenheit to degrees K
      Parameters:
      degF - degrees Fahrenheit
      Returns:
      degrees Kelvin

    • RtoK

      private double RtoK(double degR)
      Private method to convert degrees Rankine to degrees Kelvin
      Parameters:
      degR - degrees Rankine
      Returns:
      degrees Kelvin

    • CtoK

      private double CtoK(double degC)
      Private method to convert degrees Celsius to degrees Kelvin.
      Parameters:
      degC - degrees Celsius
      Returns:
      degrees Kelvin

    • KtoF

      private double KtoF()
      Private method to convert this temperature from Kelvin to Fahrenheit.
      Returns:
      degrees Fahrenheit

    • KtoR

      private double KtoR()
      Private method to convert this temperature from Kelvin to Rankine.
      Returns:
      degrees Rankine

    • KtoC

      private double KtoC()
      Private method to convert this temperature from Kelvin to Celsius.
      Returns:
      degrees Celsius

    • set

      public void set(double deg, Temperature.Scale scale)
      Sets this temperature to the temperature specified.
      Parameters:
      deg - degrees of the new temperature
      scale - scale of the new temperature

    • get

      public double get()
      Returns this temperature in degrees Kelvin. This method should call the get(Scale) method that takes the scale as an argument.
      Returns:
      this temperature in degrees Kelvin

    • get

      public double get(Temperature.Scale scale)
      Returns this temperature in the scale specified.
      Parameters:
      scale - the scale in which this temperature should be returned
      Returns:
      this temperature in the specified scale

    • add

      public void add(Temperature otherTemp)
      Add another temperature to this temperature .
      Parameters:
      otherTemp - Another Temperature object.

    • add

      public void add(double deg, Temperature.Scale scale)
      Add to this degree the temperature specified by the given degree and scale.
      Parameters:
      deg - The degree to be added to this temperature
      scale - The scale of the degree to be added to this temperature.

    • sub

      public void sub(Temperature otherTemp)
      Subtract another temperature from this temperature. The result cannot be less than absolute zero.
      Parameters:
      otherTemp - Another Temperature object.

    • sub

      public void sub(double deg, Temperature.Scale scale)
      Subtract from this temperature the temperature specified by the given degree and scale. The result cannot be less than absolute zero.
      Parameters:
      deg - The degree to be added to this temperature
      scale - The scale of the degree to be added to this temperature.

    • isEqual

      public boolean isEqual(Temperature otherTemp)
      Tests if this temperature is (approximately) equal to the specified temperature. This method should call the approxEqual(double, double) method.
      Parameters:
      otherTemp - the temperature to be compared to this temperature
      Returns:
      true if this temperature is (approximately) equal to the specified temperature, false otherwise

    • isLessThan

      public boolean isLessThan(Temperature otherTemp)
      Tests if this temperature is less than the specified temperature. This method should call the isEqual(Temperature) method.
      Parameters:
      otherTemp - the temperature to be compared to this temperature
      Returns:
      true if this temperature is less than the specified temperature, false otherwise.

    • isLessThanOrEqual

      public boolean isLessThanOrEqual(Temperature otherTemp)
      Tests if this temperature is less than or (approximately) equal to the specified temperature. This method should call the isLessThan(Temperature) and isEqual methods.
      Parameters:
      otherTemp - the temperature to be compared to this temperature
      Returns:
      true if this temperature is less than or (approximately) equal to the specified temperature, false otherwise.

    • isGreaterThan

      public boolean isGreaterThan(Temperature otherTemp)
      Tests if this temperature is greater than the specified temperature. This method should call the isLessThanOrEqual(Temperature) method.
      Parameters:
      otherTemp - the temperature to be compared to this temperature
      Returns:
      true if this temperature is greater than the specified temperature, false otherwise.

    • isGreaterThanOrEqual

      public boolean isGreaterThanOrEqual(Temperature otherTemp)
      Tests if this temperature is greater than or (approximately) equal to the specified temperature. This method should call the isLessThan(Temperature) method.
      Parameters:
      otherTemp - the temperature to be compared to this temperature
      Returns:
      true if this temperature is greater than or (approximately) equal to the specified temperature, false otherwise.

    • isNotEqualTo

      public boolean isNotEqualTo(Temperature otherTemp)
      Tests if this temperature is not equal to the specified temperature. This method should call the isEqual(Temperature) method.
      Parameters:
      otherTemp - the temperature to be compared to this temperature
      Returns:
      true if this temperature is not equal to the specified temperature, false otherwise

    • approxEqual

      private boolean approxEqual(double x, double y)
      Private helper method to test if two double values are approximately.
      Parameters:
      x - first double value
      y - second double value
      Returns:
      true if the two values differ by less than 10E-12, returns false otherwise
